description: ABLATION: Contrastive loss WITHOUT energy_reg. No regularization => energies grow freely (like q209 ~440k) => dE/dx stays large => pred can match eps. Easy negatives (noise_scale=0.1, opt_steps=1) start close to data to avoid neg_dist=24 issue. High temperature T=1000 to keep softplus logits in active regime even with large E values. Tests whether removing energy_reg restores denoising while keeping contrastive active.
notes: Ablation q213: energy_reg_weight=0 so energies grow freely. T=1000 so (E_pos-E_neg)/T ~ (440k-445k)/1000 ~ -5 => softplus still has gradient (not fully saturated). opt_steps=1 + noise_scale=0.1 => easy negatives close to data (neg_dist should be ~3-5 vs q210 neg_dist=24). If pred_norm grows and cos improves => reg was the problem. If pred_norm grows but val MSE still bad => negative geometry is the problem.
